info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 01 at 11:06PM CDT until August 02 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lincoln has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Effingham County in south central Illinois... * Until 300 AM CDT. * At 1105 PM CDT, the public reported flash flooding across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen between Effingham and Dietrich. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Effingham, Teutopolis, Dieterich, Shumway, Effingham County Airport, Elliotstown and Lake Sara. This includes the following streams and drainages... Little Bishop Creek, Green Creek, Bishop Creek, Little Muddy Creek, Big Muddy Creek, Little Wabash River, Morris Creek, Limestone Creek, Blue Point Creek, Crabapple Creek, Island Creek, Salt Creek, Little Salt Creek, Dieterich Creek, Wolf Creek, Brush Creek, Shoal Creek, North Fork Shoal Creek and Second Salt Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
